conclusion: Analyze the motion of the particle in the presence of both the electric field and the magnetic field using principles of mechanics and electromagnetic fields.
Identify the initial and final conditions: particle injected from origin O with initial velocity v0 along positive x-axis, travels to point P (3L, L) in electric field.
Electric field directed along negative y-axis.
Magnetic field perpendicular to the plane and pointing inward.
Electric force acts in positive x-direction due to electric field direction.
Magnetic force acts in direction of negative x-axis due to magnetic field direction.
Use equations of motion for the particle: In electric field: d²x/dt² = -qE/m, In magnetic field: d²y/dt² = qB/m.
Substitute given values into equations: E = -qV0, B = qv0, particle travels from O to P, so x = 3L and y = L.
Solve equations to find time t using formula: t = √(2L/(qV0/m)).
Substitute given values V0 = 2L and q = 1: t = √(6L/(1 × 2L)) = √(6/2) = √3.
The time taken for the particle to move from point O to point P is √3 seconds.
